title: Update method to store queue name in Challenge model
body:
Currently, we store the queue name for each challenge using something like this:

```
challenge_queue_name = "{}-{}-{}".format(challenge_title, challenge_pk, random_challenge_id)[:75]
```

Where the challenge title can be any string. But SQS does not allow special characters in the queue name and hence we should validate the queue name before storing it. 

## Deliverables

- [ ] Write a utils function that generates a valid SQS queue name given a string as an input
- [ ] Use the function written in the previous step to generate the queue name for a challenge
- [ ] Write tests to check if the function created in the first step is robust enough

title: Command not copied properly
body: When a challenge is docker based then the command `evalai set_token ` isn't copied properly. Basically, the token isn't copied.

title: Challenges not displayed on the challenge page if > 10
body:
## Current Behaviour:
If there are more than 10 challenges on the challenge page then those challenges aren't displayed on the page.

## Expected Behaviour:
All the challenges should be displayed on the challenge page.

## Deliverables - 
- [ ] The API already returns the challenge data along with a URL for the next set of challenges.
- [ ] Make an API call to the next URL and append the data into the existing list in the controller.
- [ ] Terminate the appending once the `next` field is null in the API's response.

title: Improve exception handling for import errors in evaluation script
body:
Currently if there is a challenge evaluation script which contains some custom python package requirement which is not installed on EvalAI server, then the submission worker process gets killed automatically. Please see the example log below where `tqdm` is missing in the system.

```
worker_1  | Traceback (most recent call last):
worker_1  |   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/runpy.py", line 174, in _run_module_as_main
worker_1  |     "__main__", fname, loader, pkg_name)
worker_1  |   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/runpy.py", line 72, in _run_code
worker_1  |     exec code in run_globals
worker_1  |   File "/code/scripts/workers/submission_worker.py", line 535, in <module>
worker_1  |     main()
worker_1  |   File "/code/scripts/workers/submission_worker.py", line 516, in main
worker_1  |     load_active_challenges()
worker_1  |   File "/code/scripts/workers/submission_worker.py", line 234, in load_active_challenges
worker_1  |     extract_challenge_data(challenge, phases)
worker_1  |   File "/code/scripts/workers/submission_worker.py", line 215, in extract_challenge_data
worker_1  |     challenge_module = importlib.import_module(CHALLENGE_IMPORT_STRING.format(challenge_id=challenge.id))
worker_1  |   File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/importlib/__init__.py", line 37, in import_module
worker_1  |     __import__(name)
worker_1  |   File "/tmp/tmpm1P8t1/compute/challenge_data/challenge_59/__init__.py", line 1, in <module>
worker_1  |     from .main import evaluate
worker_1  |   File "/tmp/tmpm1P8t1/compute/challenge_data/challenge_59/main.py", line 37, in <module>
worker_1  |     from tqdm import *
worker_1  | ImportError: No module named tqdm
evalai_worker_1 exited with code 1
```

We want to make the system more robust. So, we would want to add exception handling so that the worker process doesn't get killed whenever there is a missing requirement.

title: Modify challenge phase query for displaying challenge phase detail
body:
**Current Scenario:**
The function [here](https://github.com/Cloud-CV/EvalAI/blob/master/apps/challenges/views.py#L398) will **not** throw the error even if there are no challenge phase corresponding to the challenge.

**Steps to Reproduce:** You will only be able to check it only at the API level.
Let us suppose there exists a challenge with id 34 and phase ids 120, 121. Now when you will hit the [url ](https://github.com/Cloud-CV/EvalAI/blob/master/apps/challenges/urls.py#L17)with challenge id 34 and phase id say 1 then it won't give error if phase id 1 exists(for any other challenge). 

Ideally, it this [url](https://github.com/Cloud-CV/EvalAI/blob/master/apps/challenges/urls.py#L17) should only accept the phase ids 120 and 121 and should throw error for every other phase id.

**Deliverables:**
Modify the challenge phase query [here](https://github.com/Cloud-CV/EvalAI/blob/master/apps/challenges/views.py#L406) to include the `challenge` parameter in it.

What should be added:
`challenge_phase = ChallengePhase.objects.get(challenge=challenge, pk=pk)`
Also, Update the response message to
`response_data = {'error': 'Challenge Phase {} does not exist'.format(pk)}`

title: Error in receiving message from submission queue with error 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'get'
body:
https://sentry.io/cloudcv/evalai/issues/498341967/

```
Error in receiving message from submission queue with error 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'get'
```

Note that this error occurs whenever you try to make submission to a challenge which is not active/not approved. This leads to making the submission status stuck to `SUBMITTED` state only. Instead we would like to change it to canceled and show user a readable error message that 'Sorry your submission cannot be processed since the challenge is not active or is not approved by EvalAI Admin.'

title: Add a check to stop filtering the disabled challenges under Hosted Challenges
body:
**Current Scenario:**

Currently all the challenges which are hosted by the host are filtered under `Hosted Challenges` section.
Refer here: https://github.com/Cloud-CV/EvalAI/blob/master/apps/challenges/views.py#L84

**Deliverables:**

We want to modify the behaviour by not filtering the deleted challenges by the challenge host.

**How to Fix:**

- [ ] Modify the query to `challenge = Challenge.objects.filter(creator=challenge_host_team, is_disabled=False)`.
- [ ] Add the corresponding test case.

title: Show proper error message when Yaml file config has errors
body:
### Issue:
Proper error isn't displayed when yaml config for challenge creation isn't correct.

### Culprit Url:
`/api/challenges/challenge/challenge_host_team/{challenge_host_team_pk}/zip_upload/`

### Error:
ScannerError

### Solution
Log the error & display message as:
`Error in creating challenge. Please check the yaml configuration!`
For reference: https://www.programcreek.com/python/example/100007/yaml.scanner.ScannerError

title: Error in creating challenge when host team contains more than 1 members
body:
**Issue**
This line [here](https://github.com/Cloud-CV/EvalAI/blob/5be29063e0f88549eedacd9bcbe42bae2336557e/apps/challenges/views.py#L900) throws an  exception when creating a challenge with more than one host team members.

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Create a challenge host team
2. Add two members in the team (Total team size:3)
3. Now try creating a challenge by uploading the zip file.
4. Challenge should not get created.

**Fix:**
Use `filter` instead of `get` and loop over all the returned email id's.

title: docker issues: website, database persistence, and example project
body:
I'm excited about using + contributing to this project and because I can't quite release my challenge data so I'm going the docker route.

After creating and running the docker image, a number of high-level issues were found:
* [x] it looks like some of the javascript on the website isn't functioning as expected because all of the graphics are native size and cluttered (see visual examples)
    * I have tried this on a current version of Firefox, Chrome, and Safari (on a Mac)
* [x] when creating teams, no team persists beyond a sample account; for example, if I create as `admin`, I would expect those teams to be visible by `host`, but this isn't happening
* ~~[x] the example challenge directory and zip file are not in line with what the backend is expecting, so there's some possible code shift that occurred; not only would bringing/testing this script back up to a working example help, but it may be a challenge for some users~~ (see #1590)
    * one example of how this isn't quite right is that the evaluation script is referred to as `data.py` in the yaml file, but it exists in another subdirectory in the distributed code
* ~~[x] as a question for the public website (https://evalai.cloudcv.org), is there the ability to keep the participant list closed or restricted? I know this goes against the goals of the project, but I'm looking for back-up solutions if the docker option can't be resolved in time.~~ (see #1606)
* [x] it was hard to understand where I should go to debug interactions on the system because it is split into many sub modules; for example, where can I go to test the database or web front interaction?

![UX sizing example 1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12480297/38163159-e14209fa-34b4-11e8-9c93-fcb1b43060d1.png)

title: Increase the data upload limit.
body:
## Current Behaviour
By default django supports only 2.5 MB of the data to be uploaded on the web app. Refer [here](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.10/ref/settings/#data-upload-max-memory-size) for more info.

## Effects
Due to the low upload limit the file in challenge creation using zip isn't being uploaded on the app as the size exceeds.

## Expected Behaviour
The upload limit must be increased to 10MB.

title: Fix leaderboard challenge phase split dropdown list.
Evaluation Script extraction not working properly for Zip Challenge Creation
body:
## Current Behaviour

When someone tries to upload a challenge on EvalAI, the evaluation script extraction code is buggy and whenever someone tries to make submission, then it shows the following error for each of the submission:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "scripts/workers/submission_worker.py", line 296, in run_submission
    submission_output = EVALUATION_SCRIPTS[challenge_id].evaluate(annotation_file_path,
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'evaluate'
```

## What is the error??

From what I experimented, it seems like when the `evaluation_script.zip` extraction is done at the backend, then while unzipping, there is a directory created `evaluation_script` and then while making submissions, the submission worker looks for `evaluate()` method which it cannot find and hence throws the error.

## How to fix

Ideally, one might want to extract the contents of the `evaluation_script` directory and not the directory itself. It should fix the error.

title: EVALAI Performance Metrics
body:
As the client code base is increasing, we need to focus more on Performance Issues along with additional features, each animation, each `div span` adds to the performance of the page. Hence, to drive more users and to provide the app functionalities on slower connections, we should `measure` the performance and improve it time to time.

I have generated only Homepage Metrics, will add more when we are done with this.
### Lighthouse Report 
[Lighthouse Report.pdf](https://github.com/Cloud-CV/EvalAI/files/1205702/Lighthouse.Report.pdf)

### Google Page Insights Performance Metrics

![evalai](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12194719/29040338-399647ee-7bcc-11e7-9a47-af3cab2a300f.png)

 
Some initial Pointers to work upon

- [ ]  Improving the Critical Rendering Path

- [ ]  Following RAIL model to load the animations, instead of loading them on the first load.

- [ ]  Serve images that are appropriately-sized to save cellular data.

- [ ]  Enabling text-compression.

- [ ]  Removing render-blocking stylesheets

- [ ]  Serve WebP images for better compression.

- [ ]  Loading resources asynchronously and deferring the download of unnecessary resources.

- [ ] Improving Accessibility of the app
           - [ ]  Using `alt` tag in images.
           - [ ]  Adding `lang` attribute to `html`
           - [ ]  Using proper color contrast Ratio for text visibility ( UX )

@spyshiv @deshraj Please guide.

**Bug:** The `RandomFileName` class in [base.utils](https://github.com/Cloud-CV/EvalAI/blob/master/apps/base/utils.py#L22) returns incorrect path when `id` is not provided in the path.

**Fix:** The condition on the [line 28](https://github.com/Cloud-CV/EvalAI/blob/master/apps/base/utils.py#L28) needs to be changed to `or` from `and` as `instance.pk` will always be available for upon saving a model.

title: Tests: Inconsistency in unittests for URL Patterns
body:
### Issue

The tests for URL Patterns are inconsistent. For reference, see this https://github.com/Cloud-CV/EvalAI/blob/master/tests/unit/challenges/test_urls.py#L68


There is no `challenge_phase` being created in the test and challenge_pk is passed in the URL instead of `challenge_phase_pk`. 

### How to fix

1. Create a challenge_phase for the challenge created in the tests.
2. Pass the `challenge_phase_pk` instead of `challenge_pk` in the URLs wherever required.

title: RabbitMQ: Connection closed problem
body:
### Issue encountered
```shell
ConnectionClosed: null
  File "workers/submission_worker.py", line 504, in <module>
    main()
  File "workers/submission_worker.py", line 500, in main
    channel.start_consuming()
  File "pika/adapters/blocking_connection.py", line 1681, in start_consuming
    self.connection.process_data_events(time_limit=None)
  File "pika/adapters/blocking_connection.py", line 647, in process_data_events
    self._flush_output(common_terminator)
  File "pika/adapters/blocking_connection.py", line 395, in _flush_output
    raise exceptions.ConnectionClosed()
```

### Cause

It seems like whenever a job is published to the RabbitMQ exchange, then the connection is not closed and it leads to timeout after some time. Note: The issue can be somewhere else also.

title: Teams: A user can participate in a Challenge through multiple teams
body:
### Observed behaviour

#### Steps to reproduce
1. User X participated in Challenge C with team T1
2. User Y created a team T2
3. User Y invited User X to team T2
4. User Y can participate in challenge C with team T2

### Expected behavior
Step 4 should not be allowed since user X has already participated in the challenge with Team T1. And hence user Y should be asked to choose a new team to participate in the challenge.

body:
Cases that are not covered in Polling:

## Problem 1: 
Problem occurs when the data is updated and the user is on some page except the 1st page of Pagination. 

## How to replicate?
1. Open My-submissions in one tab and goto page 2 or 3 using pagination
2. Open submission view in another tab
3. Create a submission
4. Go back to the previous tab of my-submissions
5. When you click on "Page is outdated. Click here to refresh", then you are still on the 3rd page with the updated data but you should be redirected to the first page of pagination with the updated data.

## Problem 2:
When the submission status changes, then the data is not updated on the client side since we are checking the length of the response and not the content of the response. Please see line https://github.com/Cloud-CV/EvalAI/blob/master/frontend/src/js/controllers/challengeCtrl.js#L614

We want to modify the serializers returning the Image URLs or File URLs. 

Please see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/23918619/django-rest-framework-and-filefield-absolute-url for more details.

title: Update status field of Participant model to be a charfield
body:
Presently status is a foreign key to model __ParticipantStatus__ where we are adding only 5 values. If __ParticipantStatus__ had only status as primary key, then it would have made sense as then status can have N number of values like
```
class ParticipantStatus(models.Model):
   status = models.CharField(max_length=30, primary_key=True)
```


But with current design we are sure, that status will have 5 choices as of now. Hence converting it to a charfield with choices as options makes more sense
